parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Creates an object of the given type. Created object is not transferred through network in MP games. [[netId]] of such vehicle in multiplayer will be "0:0". To disable local vehicle creation, use [[CfgDisabledCommands]] to blacklist this command. Alternatively, you can use [[createSimpleObject]] with local option enabled where applicable.</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> type '''createVehicleLocal''' position </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> type: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> position: [[Position]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_lightsource = "#lightpoint" [[createVehicleLocal]] _pos;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[createVehicle]], [[createMine]], [[deleteVehicle]], [[createUnit]]</value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 07:18, 5 June 2008 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Kronzky|Kronzky]]</dt><dd class="note">
If the object that is created is of the type ammo, then it will created on '''all''' clients (''tested only on VBS2''). 

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 18:04, 5 September 2013 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:DamonDaemon|DamonDaemon]]</dt><dd class="note">
Indeed the type of Ammo is transfered to '''ALL''' clients, but apparently also the muzzle effects (firing sound, light, etc.); this includes muzzles from Horns (Truck or Car Horn, Bicycle bells, etc.) as well as any other weapon. Tested on Arma 1 - Arma 2 OA (latest patch).
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<h3 style="display:none">Bottom Section</h3>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 2, 2018 - 12:16 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:demellion|demellion]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
'''WARNING:''' Do not instigate [[createVehicle]] or [[createVehicleLocal]] within a server function executed with [[Functions_Library_(Arma_3)#Pre_and_Post_Init|preInit]] flag.<br> This will cause ''"You cannot play/edit this mission"'' for a vehicles compiled from a [[Arma_3_Startup_Parameters|-mod]] and make server skip/loop that mission init.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
